the law of attraction is the belief that
positive or negative thoughts can
attract corresponding experiences and
events into a person's life it is based
on a very simple idea thoughts become
things and it is very easy to see that
this is true look around you every
human-made object was without fail once
a thought in someone's head thought
inspires action action is a making or a
doing making or doing creates our worlds
thus positive thoughts Inspire positive
action positive action is positive or
beneficial doing or making and positive
or beneficial doing or making creates a
positive or beneficial world even our
personal private or subjective worlds
unfortunately habitual negative thinking
will yield the opposite results it can
create an extremely unhappy even hellish
subjective or inner world for us
there is no more effective way of
radically changing our lives for the
better than changing our thinking our
thoughts from negative thoughts to
positive thoughts but how
recent scientific studies in
Neuroscience particularly in
neuroplasticity or the brain's ability
to reorganize itself and think
differently by forming new connections
between neurons can be very helpful
research in neuroplasticity has shown
that by engaging in positive thinking
and or practicing gratitude the very
structure and function of our brains
change activity in certain regions of
the brain linked to positive thought is
also greatly increased
[Music]
foreign
the law of attraction is often
associated with the practice of positive
affirmations and visualization in these
practices a person focuses their
thoughts and energy on positive outcomes
in order to attract them into their life
Neuroscience shows us why this works so
well by forming the habit of thinking
positively we create new neural Pathways
in the brain the more we do this the
more these neuronal pathways are laid
down in the brain and the easier it
becomes for us to think positively so
what are the practices and habits which
helped form these neuronal Pathways in
the brain gratitude positive self-talk
good company cultivating brain health
challenging negative thoughts
gratitude is simply the practice of
focusing on the things in your life that
you are grateful for you can focus on
your relationships Health experiences
almost anything that you feel happy or
grateful about and always remember
nothing is too small or insignificant to
be grateful for you could be grateful
merely for the air that you breathe or
the legs that you stand upon research
has shown that practicing gratitude
improves mood reduces Stress and Anxiety
and increases our sense of overall
well-being Neuroscience tells us that
expressing gratitude has profoundly
positive effects on the brain
recent Studies have shown that by
engaging in gratitude practices there is
an increased activity in the prefrontal
cortex this is the brain region involved
in regulating emotions and controlling
Behavior there is also increased
activity in the hypothalamus a brain
region involved in stress regulation you
can easily practice gratitude by
expressing gratitude to others either
through verbal appreciation through acts
of kindness or just writing down each
day what you are grateful for
foreign
self-talk refers to the internal
dialogue that we have with ourselves the
ever present inner voice which can turn
against us with negative talk the
popular spiritual teacher and author of
The Power of Now Eckhart Tolle says that
our Inner Voice or self-talk can have a
devastating effect on our mental and
emotional well-being this voice or
self-talk can keep us stuck in the past
or worrying constantly about things that
may never happen negative self-talk is
the primary generator of our negative
thinking and therefore of negative
outcomes in our lives we can change this
by first learning to quieten the Mind
through meditation or by mindfulness
that is directing our focus and
attention to the present moment Once the
mind is quiet we become less caught up
in the momentum of negative thoughts
about ourselves it is this slowing of
the momentum of negative thinking by
meditation or mindfulness that allow
allows for the Turning of our attention
and focus away from the arising of
negative self-talk this creates the
internal space necessary to be able to
redirect our thoughts to more positive
and beneficial thinking over time we
learn to cultivate a more and more
compassionate inner voice we learn to
talk to ourselves as we would to a good
friend that we love we replace negative
thoughts and self-criticism with
positive self-talk for example instead
of saying to yourself I'm so stupid I
can't do anything right you might
instead say I made a mistake but that's
okay I'll learn from it and try again
what happens to our brains when we do
this researching Neuroscience has shown
that practicing positive self-talk
increases activity in the prefrontal
cortex this is the region of the brain
that is involved in decision making
problem solving and regulating emotions
by increasing activity in this brain
region we can improve our mood and
greatly reduce stress Awakening this
region of the brain through positive
self-talk engenders confidence and the
feeling that we can cope and resolve
almost any situation positive self-talk
helps to form strong neural connections
that lead to further positive thinking
leading to more and more positive action
and more positive World building whether
the inner or outer World positive
self-talk has also been shown to
increase the production of brain derived
neurotrophic Factor pdnf This Is A
protein that supports the growth and
maintenance of brain cells which helps
to improve brain function and support
good mental health in other words
positive self-talk makes our brain grow
and keeps it healthy the four primary
strategies for cultivating positive
self-talk are one identity negative
self-talk pay attention to the thoughts
you have about yourself and your
abilities when you notice negative
thoughts try to recognize them as Just
Thoughts rather than facts
2. replace negative thoughts with
positive thoughts when you catch
yourself having negative thoughts try to
reframe them in a more positive light
for example instead of thinking I'm not
good enough try thinking I'm doing my
best and that's all that matters
3. practice gratitude focusing on the
things you are grateful for can help to
shift your mindset from negative to
positive take some time each day to
reflect on the things that are going
well in your life
4. be kind to yourself treat yourself
with the same kindness and compassion
you would show to a friend avoid
self-criticism and judgment and try to
be understanding and forgiving of
yourself
[Music]
good company is important not only for
our capacity to think positively but
also for brain health good company is to
surround ourselves with positive and
supportive people this can very quickly
improve our mood and our outlook on life
being around others who are positive and
encouraging is one of the fastest ways
of reinforcing our own positive thinking
research has shown that contact with
positive and optimistic people is very
important to mental well-being when we
are in good company our brain releases
the chemicals oxytocin and dopamine
these greatly reduce stress and improve
mood which are both prerequisites to
positive thinking interacting with
others who are good company can help to
stimulate the brain and improve our
brain function a study published in the
journal psychology and aging showed that
older adults who surrounded themselves
with positive and optimistic friends
considerably slowed their age of
cognitive decline this also
substantially lowered any risk of them
developing dementia it is also true that
good company or being around positive
supportive and optimistic people
significantly shape our thoughts and
behaviors in other words being around
positive people means we are more likely
to adopt a positive outlook on life and
therefore grow our capacity for positive
thinking
[Music]
one of the major factors in the capacity
for positive thinking the kind of
positive thinking that leads to positive
action and therefore creates positive
outcomes for us is a healthy brain in
fact a healthy brain is perhaps the
greatest of all age to positive thinking
Neuroscience has shown that there is a
strong link between our brain health and
our mental health when our brain is
functioning at its best we are more
likely to feel positive and motivated
and we are better able to cope with
stress and challenges Neuroscience has
revealed the five main reasons why a
healthy brain supports positive thinking
one a healthy brain is better able to
regulate emotions and manage stress
which makes it easier to stay positive
and optimistic 2. a healthy brain is
more resilient and better able to bounce
back from setbacks which can help
maintain a positive outlook even in the
face of challenges 3. a healthy brain is
better able to process and interpret
information accurately which can help us
see the world more objectively and avoid
negative thinking patterns such as
negative bias or distorted thinking 4. a
healthy brain is better able to engage
in problem solving and creative thinking
which can help us find solutions to
problems and see opportunities for
growth and Improvement 5. a healthy
brain is more responsive to positive
experiences and stimuli which can help
us feel good and maintain a positive
outlook so how do we create and maintain
a healthy brain interestingly most of
the practices that support positive
thinking also support brain health
therefore gratitude positive self-talk
good company or social connection
challenging negative thinking and
substituting positive thinking all of
these as we have mentioned have been
shown by Neuroscience to be profoundly
helpful in supporting our brain Health
however there is one practice that we
have not mentioned that has the most
incredible benefit for brain health and
that is exercise
almost all types of exercise have a
strong beneficial effect on the brain
and therefore on our capacity for
positive thought regular physical
activity has been shown to have numerous
benefits for brain health including
improving cognition increasing
neuroplasticity and reducing the risk of
age-related cognitive decline exercise
has been found to increase the
production of brain derived neurotrophic
Factor bdnf A protein that supports the
growth and maintenance of brain cells
exercise has also been found to improve
blood flow to the brain which can help
to support brain function all of this
means that exercise has a positive
effect on mood and emotional well-being
both of which help support positive
thinking and remember as the Law of
Attraction States positive thought
attracts positive outcomes quite simply
because positive thought inspires or
attracts positive action and positive
action creates positive emotions events
such operations and ultimately creates
or attracts positive worlds and those
worlds can either be objective worlds or
are subjective worlds of emotion feeling
and our sense of well-being and
happiness there is one other practice
that is almost equal to exercise when it
comes to Optimum brain health and that
is
sleep
[Music]
adequate sleep is essential for brain
health and cognitive function lack of
sleep can negatively impact mood memory
and problem solving skills making it
more difficult to think positively
neuroscientific research over the last
20 years has revealed the vital
importance of quality sleep in
maintaining brain health and therefore
supporting our capacity for positive
thinking there are four main areas in
which quality sleep achieves this 1.
memory consolidation sleep plays a
crucial role in consolidating memories
and strengthening the connections
between neurons in the brain this helps
improve learning and memory and can
support Positive Thinking by enabling us
to access and use our past experiences
and knowledge in a more effective way
two emotional regulation sleep has been
shown to regulate emotions and prove
mood which can support positive thinking
lack of sleep can lead to irritability
negative mood and difficulty managing
emotions which can make it more
difficult to think positively three
cognition adequate sleep is essential
for maintaining cognitive function
including problem solving decision
making and attention lack of sleep can
impair these functions making it more
difficult to think positively and make
good decisions 4. Stress Management
sleep helps regulate the body's stress
response and can help reduce the
negative effects of stress on the brain
this can support Positive Thinking by
reducing the impact of stress on mood
and cognitive function

positive thought as the ground or

paradoxically to achieve the goals that

take a time out in the form of

best for us to interrupt that negative
flow thought and start again freshly
after meditation a nap or a deep dream
of sleep there are three types of action
inspired action this flows from positive
states of Mind as has been mentioned
effortful action this is the type of
faction we take even if we do not feel
like it action we force ourselves to do
both forms of action will produce
results and sometimes effortful action

the difference in the effectiveness
between inspired action and effortful

illustrates the difference you could
vacuum your entire house doing the best
possible job that you could do not
missing a square inch moving the couch
vacuuming underneath it making sure
you're vacuumed every inch of the rug
Etc however if the vacuum had not been
plugged in the entire time vacuumed the
effectiveness of the action would be
greatly reduced no matter how hard you
worked or how thoroughly you worked the
difference between inspired action
action flowing from positive emotions
and states of mind and effortful action
action forced regardless of your
emotional state or state of mind is the
difference between Plugged In Action and
unplugged action there is a third type
of action which has been communicated
over thousands of years by ancient
religious traditions and by indigenous
ways of knowing is being more effective
than either inspired action or effortful
action Neuroscience of the last 30 years
has also began to reveal this third type
of action in the workings of the human
brain this third type of action is
effortless effort known in Chinese
taoism is Wu way
the concept of War way which is often
translated as non-action or effortless
action has its roots in the Chinese
philosophy of taoism will Wei refers to
the idea that true success and
fulfillment come not from trying too
hard or exerting too much control but
from allowing things to unfold naturally
and in alignment with a natural flow of
the universe this concept may seem
counterintuitive to many in the modern
world where effort and control are often
seen as key ingredients for Success
Recent research in Neuroscience is
beginning to shed light on the
relationship between wu-way the Law of
Attraction and how our brains function
in a state of worry but first let's look
at another important Concept in taoism
and that is the accomplishing power of
the Deep Mind Taoism believes by letting
go of our quieting our discursive or
thinking mind we allow a much more
effective and Powerful deeper mind and
even though this deeper mind is outside
our conscious awareness it can be a
powerful source of inspiration for
Action that benefits not only us but
those around us this understanding of a
deep and beneficial mind outside our
conscious awareness is also found in the

was the religion that existed in Tibet

burn shares many of the same Concepts

and beneficial guidance according to

and emotions and then secondly by

attractions two main steps are one raise
your vibration raise your vibration by
focusing on positive thoughts and
feelings this involves cultivating
positive emotions and shifting your
focus away from negative thoughts and
feelings 2. allow your desires to

traction process is to allow your

steps or two phases of the Law of
Attraction point to an important
distinction the distinction between
thoughts you think and thoughts you
receive Step One is the active or effort
of your thinking less resistant thoughts
positive thinking step two you have now

non-resistant thought to receive thought

understanding how the Law of Attraction
Works incredibly recent Neuroscience has
come to many of the same conclusions it
points to the two operating networks in
the brain the default mode Network
previously known as the task negative
Network the task positive Network the
default mode Network dmn and the task
positive Network are two distinct
networks of the brain that are active at
different times and play different roles
in cognitive function the default mode
network is active when we are thinking
about ourselves often in negative or
problematic ways EG negative self-talk
or worrying about the future the default
mode Network stops being active when we
are engaged in tasks or the outside
world instead the task positive Network
becomes active when we are engaged in
tasks of the outside world for example
while playing a sport or involved in
drawing we may forget ourselves and or
lose all sense of time as the default
mode Network quietens we can also
effectively quieten the default mode
Network through meditation mindfulness
or through the practices of positive
thinking previously mentioned in the
study of long-term meditators
neuroscientists have observed that some
meditators can completely shut down
their default mode Network on the other
hand neuroscientists have observed in
those suffering from attention deficit
disorder add the their default mode
network is overactive and rarely if ever
shuts down during their waking hours
interestingly those practices that
increase our capacity to think positive
thoughts include those of meditation
exercise and sleep also tend to quieten
the default mode network of the brain
these practices quieten that part of the
brain that produces worry and fear
another thing that happens when the
default mode network quietens is that
the task positive Network awakens and
becomes very active the task positive
network is that part of the brain that
solves problems and presents Solutions
the task positive network is far more
powerful than the default mode Network
the task positive Network however
regardless of a superior power will shut
down as soon as the default mode Network
becomes active as an exam example of
this you're trying to read or complete a
task and your mind keeps interrupting
and you wander off into Daydreams but
most importantly the task positive
network is at its most effective problem
solving and solution providing function
outside of your conscious awareness
examples of this are the scientists or
mathematician who goes and has a shower
not thinking of his problem and suddenly
the long sword for answer miraculously
just pops into their head or the
novelist who goes to sleep trying to
solve a plot point and the answer is

will weigh in Deep Mind Tibetan bonds
Shen mind and the law of attractions art
